Articles.Content:
Ok, I know this game is about LAUNCHING rockets but that's not what I mean.

Long story short: Every time i launch the game it gets slower. You know the drill. Launch the game, play a bit, save, click the red cross(I don't actually click it!).

With fresh install it works fine. The game clock ticks as it should and the in-game time is green. But after some time the anti-kraken-bullet-time kicks in. And it happens more and more with every game start-up. I found a way around it by just doing the phys warp, but then the frames get worse.

It happens to the stock game as well as to the modded one.

Any thoughts? Am I the only one experiencing it?

Edited October 10, 2014 by Veeltch

We need more information as detailed in the Stock Support and Bug Reporting Guide sticky.

Is there anything else that could be causing this? Is the max physics delta time per frame setting changing or are the ships increasing in part count?

No, the physics delta time is not changing. And most of my crafts don't even have 100 parts.

KSP version is Win 32-bit on Steam, but I don't think it matters.

My guess would be that it happens because in a fresh install the game doesn't load everything(the whole planet terrain, parts, etc.). After another game start-up it, for some reason, loads everything that should(or should not) be loaded. But it's just my guess. I'm no coding expert.
